title: Watch: Eyewitness captures video of Colorado attack scene
summary: Eight people are being treated for injuries after a man 'started setting people on fire' at a mall in Boulder, Colorado, on Sunday . Authorities say the suspect was seen throwing Molotov cocktails, and using other devices to hurt people .

title: Mount Etna erupts as large plumes rise from Italian volcano
summary: Mount Etna erupts as large plumes of ash and smoke rise from volcano . Images and video from the island of Sicily show volcanic material spilling out of volcano . The full scale of the eruption is currently unclear .

title: Ukraine drones strike bombers during major attack in Russia
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky said 117 drones were used in the so-called "Spider's Web" operation . Russia confirmed Ukrainian attacks in five regions, calling them a "terrorist act"  Ukrainian authorities report massive drone and missile attack on its territory over the weekend . At least six people, including a seven-year-old child, were injured following a strike in Kharkiv .

title: Al-Qaida affiliate attacks Mali army bases as junta struggles to contain jihadist threat
summary: An al-Qaida-linked group has launched an assault on a Malian army base in Timbuktu . The attack comes a day after it claimed responsibility for another attack near the border with Burkina Faso . As many as 30 soldiers were killed in the attack .

title: Inquest into notorious apartheid-era killings opens in South Africa
summary: The Cradock Four were stopped at a roadblock on 27 June 1985 by security officers . They were beaten, strangled with telephone wire, stabbed and shot to death . In 1999, the country’s Truth and Reconciliation Commission refused an amnesty for their role .

title: UK should impose sanctions on Egypt over jailed activist, says Helena Kennedy
summary: The UK government should impose sanctions on key figures in the Egyptian government in response to its refusal to release the British-Egyptian human rights activist . The UK should take the case to the international court of justice, as France has recently done in the case of a national held by Iran . Helena Kennedy has urged the UK government to elevate the case to a much higher level .

title: Poland election results: Who won, who lost, what’s next
summary: Karol Nawrocki, Poland's right-wing opposition candidate, narrowly won the second round of voting in the country’s presidential election on Sunday . He defeated liberal Warsaw Mayor Rafal Trzaskowski, who secured 49.11 percent of the vote . The outcome was a surprise because exit polls had projected a narrow loss .

title: ‘Restricted’: Nearly 7 billion people worldwide lack full civil rights
summary: Just 3.5 per cent of the world's population is under threat to freedom of expression . The majority of the population is in the form of freedom of speech . 85 percent of the world’s population lives in countries where civil society is restricted, suppressed or closed, the report found .

title: Ukraine bombs Russian bases: Here are some of Kyiv’s most audacious attacks
summary: Drones strike four Russian airbases in five regions, causing several aircraft to catch fire . Air defences repelled the assaults in all but two regions, the Russian Defence Ministry said . Russian Defence Ministry said some of the attacks had been carried out on Sunday .

title: Tehran to defend nuclear program
summary: Iran’s uranium enrichment activities are entirely peaceful, Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has insisted . Trump reportedly gave Iran a two-month deadline to make a nuclear deal with the US, threatening “bombing” if it does not . Iran says it is not interested in a nuclear deal with the U.S. President Donald Trump .

title: Russia demands Ukraine stop false ‘child kidnapping’ claims
summary: Vladimir Medinsky: Ukraine must stop making false claims about alleged 'child kidnapping' Medinsky made the remarks following the second round of negotiations with Kiev’s delegation at the Istanbul talks . He said Ukraine had submitted a list of 339 children affected by the conflict . Moscow has said it evacuates children from the conflict zone to save their lives .

title: Kiev comments on latest round of negotiations with Moscow
summary: Moscow and Kiev have agreed to exchange the bodies of thousands of fallen soldiers, Ukrainian Defense Minister Rustem Umerov announced on Monday following the second round of direct talks in Istanbul . Both sides have reportedly reached an agreement to exchange all seriously wounded and seriously ill prisoners of war in an “all-for-all” format . Monday’s talks mark the second time Russian and Ukrainian negotiators have met directly to discuss the resolution of the Ukraine conflict since Kiev abandoned peace efforts back in 2022 .

title: Russia becomes one of global leaders in number of franchises — analysts
summary: Russia has become one of the global leaders in terms of the number of franchises per capita, according to figures presented during the Russian Retail Week by Alexey Shashkin, Director of the Small and Micro Business division at Sber . He cited analysis conducted in collaboration with consulting firm Strategy Partners . In 2024 the market turnover increased by 17% to reach 3.72 trillion rubles ($47 bln) and the number of franchises grew by 12% .

title: Russian soldiers behave responsibly towards children in Ukraine — Medinsky
summary: Russian servicemen behave towards children in special military operation in Ukraine as responsibly as Soviet soldiers did in Berlin, Kremlin Aide Vladimir Medinsky said . Russia’s "shameful PR campaign" on this score must be stopped, he said . The Russian delegation was led by Kremlin Aide Medinsky .

title: IOC decided to bar Russian ice hockey teams from 2026 Olympics, says IIHF chief Tardif
summary: IOC decision to bar Russian ice hockey teams from 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Italy has been made by the International Olympic Committee (IOC), President of the International Ice Hockey Federation (IIHF) Luc Tardif told TASS . The IIHF Council ruled at its session to extend its sanctions against the Russian and Belarusian teams through the 2025-2026 season . The 2026 Winter Olympic Games will be held in Italy, in the cities of Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo .

title: Satellite lofted for first Arab country
summary: A Chinese-made communications satellite became the first "export" of such a spacecraft to an Arab country . President Xi Jinping and his Algerian counterpart Abdelaziz Bouteflika exchanged congratulatory messages on Monday morning . Xi Jinping said China is willing to work with Algeria to strengthen exchanges and cooperation in various fields .

title: Satellite lofted for first Arab country
summary: A Chinese-made communications satellite became the first "export" of such a spacecraft to an Arab country . President Xi Jinping and his Algerian counterpart Abdelaziz Bouteflika exchanged congratulatory messages on Monday morning . Xi Jinping said China is willing to work with Algeria to strengthen exchanges and cooperation in various fields .

title: WWII memorials solemn reminders of war tragedy
summary: Dec 13 marks the National Memorial Day for Nanjing Massacre Victims, which is established to commemorate the 300,000 Chinese people killed by Japanese troops after the fall of Nanjing in World War II .

title: Australia to gift Guardian-class patrol boat to Maldives
summary: Australia will gift a Guardian-class patrol boat to the Maldives . The vessel is under construction and scheduled for completion in 2026 . The hydrographic equipment will support Maldives’ capability to map its ocean floor .

title: Ukraine and Russia end their latest round of direct peace talks in Istanbul
summary: Delegations from Russia and Ukraine ended peace talks Monday (June 2, 2025) in Turkiye after just over an hour . Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said both sides “exchanged documents through the Turkish side”  The operation destroyed or heavily damaged nearly a third of Moscow’s strategic bomber fleet, according to Ukrainian officials . Ukraine also handed Russia an official list of children it says were forcibly deported and must be returned .

title: Air India expands codeshare partnership with Air Mauritius
summary: Air India and Air Mauritius will place their designator codes on 17 routes between India, Mauritius, Reunion, South Africa, and Madagascar . The expanded codeshare partnership pact was signed by Air India CEO and MD Campbell Wilson . IATA annual general meeting of the International Air Transport Association (IATA) in the National Capital .

title: 'You're killing my people so I kill you': Witness recounts Colorado attacker Mohamed Sabry Soliman shouted before setting fire
summary: Mohamed Sabry Soliman targeted a Jewish crowd with a flamethrower and Molotov cocktails but no one died from the attack . Witnesses said Soliman was singling people out and called them 'killer' Soliman took off his vest when they started to catch the fire . Donald Trump's aide Laura Loomer said the GOP is also not addressing the actual issue and calling Soliman an illegal immigrant but not an 'Islamic terrorist' She said Soliman's daughter just graduated high school as class of 2025 and has been accepted to both the University of Colorado Colorado Springs and Colorado University in Denver .

title: Megha Vemuri reacts to MIT ban, trolling after pro-Palestine speech: 'I can handle the attention, positive and negative'
summary: Megha Vemuri said she can handle the attention, both positive and negative, if it means spreading the message further . Vemurri got an instant backlash from MIT as the institute informed her that she and her family would not be allowed to take part in Friday's ceremony . MIT will not hold her degree back and she will get her degree .

title: Indian-origin man pinned to ground by cop in Australia, wife screams; police chief say it was not wrong
summary: Indian-origin man Gaurav Kundi, 42, was pinned down to the Payneham Road in Adelaide's eastern suburbs while he was being arrested by the police . His wife Amritpal Kaur said police slammed his head against the car and also on the road . Doctors said his brain and neck nerves were severely damaged .

title: How the Korean Right Turned MAGA Ahead of Tomorrow’s Election
summary: South Korea’s recently impeached president, Yoon Suk Yeol, cradling puppies . The Hongdae area, known for its progressive crowd and art scene, is packed with around 3,000 conservatives . Pro-Yoon rallies marked by MAGA hats and American flags have erupted weekly since January .

title: The Futile Quest to Build a “Liberal Joe Rogan”
summary: Democratic operatives have a $20 million plan to build a "Joe Rogan of the left" The plan was immediately panned online by critics who argued that young men would view this type of approach as inauthentic . An analysis of 320 of the most popular online shows across platforms such as Youtube, Rumble, and TikTok found that right-leaning shows were significantly more popular, accounting for roughly 82% percent of the total following of online shows . Experts say investing millions to recreate a “Joe Rogan of the left” fundamentally misunderstands why young men moved so rapidly to the right .

title: How Student Protesters and Immigrants Became Targets of Trump’s Surveillance Tech
summary: New York Focus investigates how surveillance technology is being weaponized to silence dissent on American campuses and fuel the deportations of immigrants . A new one-strike visa cancellation policy will be used for visa interviews with foreign students . The effort is powered by more companies than most people realize .
